organization.description: The name of the organization that owns the host system.

time_zone.description: The system should always report date/time using the following time zone.

timeout.description: Default timeout used for all communications between each module (in seconds).

log_config.description: The global Log4perl configuration file, used throughout all modules. This setting should not need to be changed.

syslog_address.description: The IP address of the syslog server that all logging messages will be sent to by both Agent and Manager processes over UDP port 514.

stomp_address.description: The IP address of the STOMP server that will send/receive all messages to/from various HoneyClient components.

stomp_port.description: The TCP port number used to communicate with the STOMP server.

stomp_user_name.description: The user name used to authenticate to the STOMP server.

stomp_password.description: The password used to authenticate to the STOMP server.

stomp_virtual_host.description: The virtual host used to authenticate to the STOMP server.

address.description: The IP or hostname that all Agent modules should use, when accepting SOAP requests.

timeout.description: How long the Manager should wait for a response from the Agent, before timing out the VM (in seconds).

port.description: The TCP port number that the SOAP server for all Agent modules will listen on for requests.

screenshot.description: A boolean, indicating if a screenshot of the OS display should be taken upon each drive operation. Note: Enabling this functionality may significantly slow drive operations.

allowed_drivers.description: List of implemented Drivers that the Agent is allowed to run directly.
allowed_drivers.name: HoneyClient::Agent::Driver::Browser::IE
HoneyClient::Agent::Driver::Browser::FF

default_driver.description: If no driver is manually specified, then this Driver will be used as the default by the Agent.

timeout.description: How long the Driver waits during a drive operation, before timing out (in seconds).

process_exec.description: The absolute path to the Internet Explorer application process, as it sits in the VM filesystem.

process_name.description: The name of the Internet Explorer executable, as it appears on the VM filesystem.

load_complete_image.description: A PNG image of the browser's status bar, when the browser has fully rendered all content on the screen. The X and Y coordinates indicate the bottom-left edge of the rectangle, representing the browser's status bar region when the browser is fully maximized and brought to the foreground on a Windows VM whose screen resolution is 1024x768. To disable this functionality altogether, specify a nonexistant file.

maximize_registry.description: A registry file which contains settings that keep IE fully maximized between consecutive drive operations.

image_sample_delay.description: When VM display sampling is enabled, this variable indicates how long to wait (in seconds) between consecutive sample operations.

process_exec.description: The absolute path to the Mozilla Firefox application process, as it sits in the VM filesystem.

process_name.description: The name of the Mozilla Firefox executable, as it appears on the VM filesystem.

perform_integrity_checks.description: An integer, representing whether the Agent should perform any integrity checks. 1 enables, 0 disables.

changes_found_file.description: When an integrity check fails, all changes will be written to this file within the compromized honeyclient VM's filesystem.

realtime_changes_file.description: When an integrity check fails, all changes will be written to this file within the compromized honeyclient VM's filesystem.
When an integrity check fails, all changes will be written to this file within the compromized honeyclient VM's filesystem.

enable.description: Enables active content parsing. 1 enables, 0 disables.

ignore_links_timed_out.description: If this parameter is 1, then the browser will never attempt to revisit any links that caused the browser to initially time out.

limit_spidering.description: When set to 1, the Browser will not visit any derived links other than the initial set of URLs given. This is useful when you want the Browser to only visit a specific set of URLs (perhaps malicious) and no other links that it finds on any of the visited pages. When set to 1, this option will override max_relative_links_to_visit (essentially setting it to 0). If you want the Browser to spider through derived links, set this value to 0.

max_relative_links_to_visit.description: An integer, representing the maximum number of relative links that the browser should visit, before moving onto another website. If negative, then the browser will exhaust all possible relative links found, before moving on. This functionality is best effort; it's possible for the browser to visit new links on previously visited websites. Note that this value can be overridden if limit_spidering is set to 1 above.

positive_words.description: If a link contains any number of these words, then its probability of being visited (its score) will increase.

negative_words.description: If a link contains any number of these words, then its probability of being visited (its score) will decrease.

virtualization_mode.description: This value dictates that VMware ESX Server (HoneyClient::Manager::ESX) is used as the primary virtualization mode.

worker_startup_delay.description: The amount of time (in seconds) that the Manager should wait between starting up successive clone VMs, so that the host system is not initially overwhelmed by too much activity.

fingerprint_dump.description: When the Manager encounters a suspicious VM, it will attempt to append a complete copy of the fingerprint information to this file, if specified.

address.description: The IP or hostname that all Manager modules should use, when accepting SOAP requests.

port.description: The TCP port number that the SOAP server for all Manager modules will listen on for requests.

num_urls_to_process.description: If database support is enabled, this value indicates how many URLs the Manager will fetch from the database, process, and report back, before fetching for more URLs.

database_retry_delay.description: If database support is enabled, this value indicates how often (in seconds) the Manager will retry contacting the database, when it is ready for more URLs to process and no URLs were provided during the first request.

command_line_base_priority.description: When the Manager is supplied URLs from the command line, it will assign each URL the following numerical base priority.

exchange_name.description: The name of the STOMP exchange used to send messages to this component.

queue_name.description: The name of the STOMP queue used to receive messages sent to this component.

routing_key.description: The routing key used on all STOMP messages sent to this component.

allowed_outbound_ports.description: By default, when a clone VM is started, the firewall will allow the VM to connect to any remote server on that server's following ports. Note: Only TCP communication is supported.

exchange_name.description: The name of the STOMP exchange used to send messages to this component.

queue_name.description: The name of the STOMP queue used to receive messages sent to this component.

routing_key.description: The routing key used on all STOMP messages sent to this component.

exchange_name.description: The name of the STOMP exchange used to send messages to this component.

queue_name.description: The name of the STOMP queue used to receive messages sent to this component.

routing_key.description: The routing key used on all STOMP messages sent to this component.

directory.description: The directory used to save all packet capture sessions, relative to the honeyclient root directory.

capture_interface.description: The physical network interface to perform all packet capture sessions.

promiscuous.description: A boolean, indicating if the capture interface should be in promiscuous mode.

snaplen.description: The snapshot length indicating how many bytes should be captured per packet.

tcpdump_bin.description: The absolute path and filename, indicating the location of the tcpdump binary.

session_timeout.description: The amount of time (in seconds) a VIM session remains active, before automatically expiring due to inactivity. The default time is 15 minutes, since the default VMware ESX Server expires inactive sessions older than 30 mintues.

timeout.description: The amount of time (in seconds) that we will wait for a VIM response from the VMware ESX Server, before timing out.

vm_id_length.description: The length of each corresponding VM identifier (VMID). This value can be any integer between 1 and 32, inclusive. The VMID is a hexadecimal string that represents the VM's name. It is designed to be generated once per clone and remain for the life of the VM (regardless of where it runs). The VMID is used externally by HoneyClient::Manager and HoneyClient::Manager::FW. The HoneyClient::Manager::FW package uses IPTables and binds each rule to a specific VMID. However, IPTable's firewall rule labels can only be a maximum of 30 characters in length. Thus, 26 is specified here, to account for 'VMID-OUT' as a possible chain name.

default_quick_clone_snapshot_name.description: When performing a quick clone, this value is the name of the initial snapshot that is created on the clone VM.
default_quick_clone_snapshot_name.default: Initial Snapshot - DO NOT ALTER OR RENAME THIS SNAPSHOT

ESX.default_quick_clone_snapshot_name: Initial Snapshot - DO NOT ALTER OR RENAME THIS SNAPSHOT

default_quick_clone_snapshot_description.description: When performing a quick clone, this value is the description of the initial snapshot that is created on the clone VM.

ESX.default_quick_clone_snapshot_description: State: Initialized - This snapshot marks the initial state of this clone VM, that is then used by all subsequent snapshots. WARNING: If you alter delete this snapshot (or any dependent snapshots), then all dependent snapshots will become corrupted as well.

default_quick_clone_master_annotation.description: When performing a quick clone, we annotate the source VM in order to inform the user to NEVER alter the source VM ever again.

ESX.default_quick_clone_master_annotation: Type: Master VM WARNING: DO NOT ALTER THIS VM FURTHER OTHERWISE, ALL SUBSEQUENT CLONES WILL BE CORRUPTED

operational_quick_clone_snapshot_descrip.description: When initializing a new clone, this value is the description of the operational snapshot that is created on the clone VM.

ESX.operational_quick_clone_snapshot_descrip: State: Operational - This snapshot marks the operational state of this clone VM. At this point, the clone VM has a valid MAC and IP address, as well as a fully-started Agent running inside the VM.

compromised_quick_clone_snapshot_descrip.description: When initializing a new clone, this value is the description of a compromised snapshot that is created on the clone VM.

ESX.compromised_quick_clone_snapshot_descrip: State: Compromised - This snapshot marks a compromised state of this clone VM. At this point, the clone VM has failed an integrity check after peforming some type of work.

master_vm_name.description: The name of the master VM on the VMware ESX system that will be used by all subsequent cloned VMs.

min_space_free.description: The minimum amount of disk space (in GB) that must remain free in the primary datastore in order for the Manager to continue processing. If the free disk space drops below this threshold, then the Manager will gracefully terminate.

max_num_snapshots.description: The maximum number of snapshots that VMware ESX should store per VM created. The default is 32 snapshots per VM. Unless VMware ESX's snapshotting implementation changes drastically in newer versions, it is recommended that this value remain 32. Otherwise, all snapshot-related operations will slow down SIGNIFICANTLY after reaching the 32 limit.

snapshot_upon_suspend.description: If set to 1, then everytime a cloned VM is suspended, a snapshot of the VM will be saved upon suspend. Set this option to 0, if you discover errors during cloning operations, where the hard disk on the VMware ESX System is overworked by slow disk operations.

work_unit_limit.description: An integer, indicating how many work units (e.g., URLs) the clone VM should process before destroying the VM and regenerating a new clone VM. This option is useful to set, when trying to drive an application that appears to create slow memory leaks within the VM's OS. For example, after processing X work units, the VM's OS runs out of memory altogether. To deal with this issue, we preemptively destroy and regenerate a new clone VM at (X-1) work units, so that the leak no longer affects our operations. To completely disable this functionality, specify -1.

max_retry_count.description: If the Worker is unable to contact the recently initialized clone VM due to connectivity issues, then the Worker will retry up to the specified number of times before reinitializing the clone VM.

vix_enable.description: When set to 1, this setting allows the code to use VIX in order to drive the application.

vix_timeout.description: The amount of time (in seconds) that we will wait for a VIX response from the VMware ESX Server, before timing out. Note: This value must be greater than HoneyClient::Agent::timeout.

service_url.description: The full URL to the VIM service running on the VMware ESX Server.

user_name.description: The username used to login to the VIM service running on the ESX server.

password.description: The password used to login to the VIM service running on the ESX server.

test_vm_name.description: The name of the test VM on the ESX server, that's used during unit testing.

address.description: The IP or hostname that this module should use, when performing unit tests.

exchange_name.description: The name of the STOMP exchange used to send messages from this component.

high_priority.description: The numerical value indicating that a message has a high priority.

low_priority.description: The numerical value indicating that a message has a low priority.

default_priority.description: The default priority to use, when sending messages.
